channel.title: Runeshock | 100% Runescape Drop Method
channel.description:
[center]Item/Amount/Percentage & The chance of the item getting rolled on. Meaning no multiple drops although in higher revisions they drop charms etc. Reference: http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Drop_rate 1080P - Song: Sunlight Hurts My Eyes https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JOh7ZBxBAhg Please forgive me not all animations are completed. Goblins have 62 items in there list. http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Goblin Giant Spiders have 20 items in there list. http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Giant_spider
When the NPC only drops bones, it means that it rolled on a rare item, but it failed to drop it due to the 1% chance of it actually dropping.[/center]

item.title: Runeshock | 100% Runescape Drop Method
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:9, topic:538957”]Make sure you watch the special notes at the bottom:

1. ^ Only during the Rag and Bone Man quest 2. ^ Only from Goblins in Goblin village wearing green 3. ^ Only from Goblins in Goblin village wearing red

You shouldn’t have obtained red armor in lumby, but only in the village outside of fally.[/quote]

Oh, thanks. didn’t see that. That can be easily fixed. Although it doesn’t really matter.

Loveandpower:

what am I missing here? o_0 you are showing off drops?..

Yeah, because every server I know doesn’t have a method where it drops one item at a time like Runescape unless their charms or something else. Instead they have an item and a percentage chance, but more than 1 item can be dropped at a time.

Read full topic

item.title: Runeshock | 100% Runescape Drop Method
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Make sure you watch the special notes at the bottom:

1. ^ Only during the Rag and Bone Man quest 2. ^ Only from Goblins in Goblin village wearing green 3. ^ Only from Goblins in Goblin village wearing red

You shouldn’t have obtained red armor in lumby, but only in the village outside of fally.

Read full topic
